column9:
Just a note about the Mac drivers. I tried these on my iMac running 10.6.8. It work fine until I restarted my computer. After that is caused a kernel panic and crashed my computer when either clone was connected. After several hours I found the offending file that was installed and removed it. It was System/Library/Extensions/usb.kext
My system doesn't crash now but also doesn't see the Arduino clones. The same driver installed on a MacBook running 10.9.5 works just great. I don't know if this driver would work OK on 10.7 or 10.8

column9: I found the answer. The CH340 Chip only works with a 12MHz oscillator. The ATMega has his own very small 16MHz Osci. So everything is fine.

There are no 10.10 Drivers for this USB/Serial Bridge right know.

Of course this will harm system security, but to be honest i was able to live without that security feature till now.
